group_1.narration: Now, will the slow and dimwitted@Nagisa Momoe really be able@to become a Magical Girl?
She must become a Magical Girl@as soon as possible, or more people@might be attacked by a Witch.
More importantly,@this story cannot continue unless@she becomes one.

group_1.textCenter: (What if I don't become a Magical Girl?)
(Would it mean I did something wrong?)

group_1.textRight: Hi, Nagisa. Sorry about yesterday.
Where are you going today?

group_1.textLeft: I'm going to buy a present to give to my mom@at the hospital tomorrow.
I don't have time for you right now.

group_1.textRight: Can't you just buy one on your way there?

group_1.textLeft: I want to pick it out carefully.
Mascarpone.
Gorgonzola.
Mimolette.

group_1.textRight: All you're buying is cheese.
That's not healthy for a girl your age.
You should try and eat a more nutritionally@balanced diet.

group_1.textLeft: These aren't for me.
I'm taking all of these cheeses to my mom.
I won't be eating them.
I actually don't like cheese very much.

group_1.textRight: Will your mom eat that much cheese?

group_1.textLeft: Maybe not all of it.
But it's better if she has a selection to@choose from.
She couldn't have it for a while.
But she's allowed to start eating it again.

group_1.textRight: Aren't you going to buy any food for@yourself?

group_1.textLeft: I ate school lunch.
Some of the leftover cheese will be enough@for me.
Did you know my mom used to be on TV?
She was beautiful and popular.
But then she married my dad...
And she got sick... And her sickness kept@getting worse...
My dad was hardly ever home because of his@work.
But then he stopped coming home at all.
He abandoned me and my mom.
Maybe that was why...
Maybe she wouldn't have gotten sick, if she@hadn't married my dad.

group_1.textRight: Do you resent your father?

group_1.textLeft: No... I'm not like that.
It's not good to resent anybody.

group_1.textRight: I see.

group_1.textLeft: I still have my mom.
I don't care if I don't have a dad.

group_1.textRight: You're the victim of a society that is not @yet fully developed.
I think becoming a Magical Girl is the best@option for a girl like you.
It will help give you hope.

group_1.textLeft: I don't think I'll be good at it.

group_1.textRight: You won't know that unless you try. I'll@even support you as best I can.

group_1.textLeft: If I say no...
Does that make me a bad person?

group_1.textRight: Not at all.
The decision should be made of your own@free will.
No one can force you to choose, or penalize@you for your choice.
I can only speak from my own experience.
In many cases, girls who choose not to make@a contract live a very difficult life.
They start to carry a heavy emotional@burden.
In your language, I think it's called@"regret".
Let me be more specific.
Let's say a girl changes her mind after some@time has passed.
She'll want her wish granted.
But by the time she's finally willing to@become a Magical Girl, it's too late.
Her potential to become one will have@dropped significantly.
I've seen that happen a lot.
To us, your lifetime is over in the blink of@an eye.
I suspect that you humans feel the same@about your life spans.
Which means you might miss your opportunity@to make this decision.
And you might not ever be able to reclaim@it.
I want you to understand your potential@to become a Magical Girl.
I want you to know how important that special@right is, before you make your decision.
I'm trying to explain everything to you as@accurately as possible.
That's why I keep coming back to see you.
If you desire it, I can grant you your wish.
I can grant almost any wish you could ask@for.
That, in itself, is a miracle.
Most humans would never get this chance in@their entire lifetime.

group_1.textLeft: I really don't think I have that kind of@power.
I really doubt it...
Also, Kyubey, this path was the long way@around.

group_1.textRight: It was? I didn't realize.
Sorry about that.

group_1.textLeft: Huh? There's something over there.
It looks kind of blurry...
Wh-what is this?!
What happened?
Where am I?!

group_1.textRight: Oh no!
We've entered a Witch's Labyrinth!

group_1.textLeft: S-something just appeared!

group_1.textRight: That's a Witch's Familiar! Nagisa, you've@got to make a—

group_1.textLeft: Huh? Kyubey?
What are you doing here?

group_1.textRight: You're...the Sleepwalking Ghost.
I'm not sure if it's lucky or unlucky to run@into you with this timing.

group_1.textLeft: Aww... Don't you appreciate me?
Fine, I'm just gonna beat these guys up real @quick.
You there, stay where you are! This is going@to be dangerous.
